jQT_V6SGBfWtpaRJ4hnw7g.text: It is definitely fun but make sure you go in the pool and get a bay on the second floor

6JiX_D4GicCIoKSy-Dln0Q.text: Wow, This place is FUN!! I had no idea... Girls trip none of us are golfers, but we are competitive...we started off one the 1st floor game/tv area where we ordered food, I wish we had eaten there but not a big deal... when we got our golf bay we had 1 hr which is why I wish we ate 1st!! our host quickly showed us how things work...And we were off!! It was incredibly fun the food was  really good, the view of the strip was cool... if you want a good time I recommend checking Topgolf out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seabass sliders and chips!
Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello burger and fries delish!!
Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatbread and Mushi? both were awesome!!

3HlEa8PWzmVOSt6amx5mdA.text: Top golf is a great reprieve from the pool parties and hustle and bustle of the casinos. My husband and I arrived around 10:00 AM and it was already packed. There was a 2 hour wait for the 1st and 2nd floor bays.  We decided to reserve a 3rd floor bay as the wait time was only 30 min.  The cost was $45 an hour and the price would of been the same for a 1&2nd floor bay if we waited the 2 hours. The prices go up $10 at noon time.  Our host was courteous and lively.  We ordered a couple of drinks and some appetizers.  The nacho stack with grilled chicken and kalbi tacos.were surprisingly good.  There are TV Screens everywhere and your scoring screen even doubles as your personal tv.  We were able to watch the world cup match while playing. After we were done with our game we went downstairs and enjoyed playing shuffleboard and corn hole.  We had a great time.

QeATjkTGEyrjwMTqIbubbg.text: My husband and I have been here twice and it's really fun. And I don't really even like golf, haha. The food is delicious, we recommend their carne asada nachos. And I have drank my fair share of their Frose's (Frozen rose) so yummy!! I'd definitely recommend this place for something fun to do in Vegas.

gcj0VZuqVgXd5LwXpsITXA.text: Located adjacent to the MGM Grand on the Famous Las Vegas Strip! Holy Mackerel this place is a massive spectacle, that is the latest must do in Las Vegas! 4 levels for golf! 2 pools and more bars than can be counted. The food is fantastic, the staff helpful and friendly. As I said before this is a must do and must be seen to be believed! So go see and go believe! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

NCUr3FSfT_RaWBKpJ0-DlA.text: I've been to Top Golf in Vegas a few times now that it has opened.  Every experience has been pretty awesome and yet so different at the same time.    I have been to hit some balls and try their food and drinks and that was awesome. The cost can add up pretty quickly, but it still seems to be a great value for the overall experience. The staff from start to finish was amazing and very helpful.  Next, I went to see a concert.  Soul Asylum!!  Yes, this venue also hosts live concerts.  The concert section was nice and small so we were able to easily see and hear the band from a few feet away.  It was amazing.  Then this last weekend we went to a Motley Brew craft beer event that was hosted on the 4th floor of Top Golf.  (On a separate note, Motley Brew events are pretty amazing themselves!) We were able to check out the entire 4th floor and hit a few balls while sampling various craft beers at the many pouring stations throughout.  All the servers/hosts were top notch and friendly, especially Kaylee who was super awesome and was pouring a great IPA brew.  So even if you just want a fresh and cool place to go hang out in Vegas, Top Golf is a great choice.  Even without doing the golf part, just watching sports on the big screens and having a beverage or three.  If their is a negative, I would say it is the parking situation.  It can get pretty backed up since it is Valet only, not just before, but the line to pick up your car can take a little while.  But the Valet crew is very friendly too and they are hustling, so it is what it is.

B616ujgH31O_JFM8kVu8cA.text: Took my wife and 2 of her girlfriends here last night and it was awesome!  I had been to the one in San Antonio 2 years ago and was extremely impressed. I was excited when they opened up this one and finally got around to going last night.   My wife and 10 year old had come here with her girlfriend and her 10 year old last month and they had a great time! So now it was my turn...   Really cool atmosphere here. The DJ was streaming some great 90's and early 2K hip hop. Drinks were great! Service was on point. Sorry to read about Michael E.'s experience and I feel that they did a lot to improve on that. Even though it was crowded, I observed that the wait staff covered 3 Bays each, it seemed. Each were posted up in the center of the 3 bays they were in charge of. Our guy, Adam F., was polite courteous and attentive. We never had to look for him or ask one of his colleagues if he can come by to fulfill a request we had.   We came and were told of a 45 min wait @ around 9:30 PM. All good, we went towards the bar area to get some food and drinks then five mins. later we got the text saying a Bay opened up. Solid!   The food is subpar- yes, but I can see them stepping it up more in the future. We played 3 games there and had a great time! It was pricy, yes - but it is Vegas and I think plan on expecting it. It was worth it for us. I and we, plan on coming back in the near future for sure!

Zd4O6JEsOJ14Mk56n7BmSA.text: This place is amazing! I booked a cabana for only two hours and very quickly regretted it when I showed up. I didn't realize that when you bring a group of guys, whether they golf or not, they're going to try their damndest to golf. So we ended up utilizing the golf bay more than I thought. The girls spent the two hours in the pool, eating and drinking, but I definitely wanted to stay longer. The crowd was super chill, the food was good, and the service is amazing.

vOOfpX0AQbgL7QVmdoDUJg.text: My hubby and I came here for date night.  Disclaimer...we both have not touched golf clubs in the last decade probably but we still had fun.  It's a pricey place, but you come in expecting as much.  We enjoyed the game concept of it versus going to a golfing range, even though technically this is a glorified golfing range.  They provide the clubs and the balls.  The balls are tracked so you know where they land and depending on the game...they equate to a certain amount of points.  For locals or military, they have a discount...so don't forget to mention that to your server.  Or if you go earlier before noon...they also offer discounts.  We picked the tier 1 since we wanted minimal wait time, and less witnesses to our subpar golf skills.  Next time, I'd try the upper levels since they offer a better for view.  I would eat dinner before I get here, the food was mediocre at best.  We got the pork skewers as a snack...and they were as dry as jerky.  Probably best with a group of 4 if your only going for an hour, any additional people and you won't get to hit too many balls.

G_mbDviomKS5usVIf_WZkw.text: First time at this venue. Parking was impossible on a Wednesday late afternoon, valet closed, I was told to park at the adjacent MGM public parking which I did and walked towards topgolf building. It felt like I walked 1/4 mile. Not happy about the parking!!!!   I'm still giving this place a 5 star for total well thought out entertainment, the open booths they call golf bay is where you rent the space hourly and prices varies depending at the time of check in. The golf bay feels like you're in your backyard swinging your clubs in an open space and lounging  around on a modern L shape couch and a big coffee  table enough for everyone to sit around and have drinks and appetizers. You don't have to be a golfer to enjoy this type of entertainment.   A set of golf clubs is provided in your bay. Since I'm a lefty, they  provided the club set right away. This is a driving range taken to the next level of pure fun! Just like bowling, it has golf monitors that keeps track of your range and distance. You see colored distance targets, Huge tv screens across the field, color lighted posts around the driving range, I'm sitting here in an open space  a/c blowing cool air overhead just made me forget the summer heat in Vegas. It was comfortable.  There's four levels of pure fun and entertainment, it has a pool and bar for private parties and the rest is for you to come out and discover this amazing place!   The staff are always around to assist if you need something. The appetizers we had tonight was a couple of flat bread pizza (looks homemade and tasted fresh), delicious chicken burrito cut up in 2" slices. Food was plated neatly, and surprisingly the food here is delicious. We had seconds of the same thing.  OVERALL:  great food,  pure entertainment and fun concept, pricey ( be prepared to spend big bucks) gets crowded, beautiful outdoor lighting at night,    parking needs to improve ASAP!!! Use Uber or Lyft!!! I'm definitely a big fan of this place! Yes, one of my go to places for entertainment.

HWnNqU3KjNNZpZ1XpMLSTw.text: This was a fun and unique experience. You pay for the hour up to 6 people. This is kind of like bowling but with golf clubs.  The first 2 floors are cheaper per hour and cheaper golf clubs ( Top Golf brand) the top two floors are more expensive but with better clubs, I forgot which brand, but a name brand.They have 2 sets of clubs per bay ( one for men and one for women).  We had to wait about 45 min before we could play but we ordered some food ( which we were not impressed w/ the service), watched the game ( they have huge screens where you can sit watch TV & order a drink) and just hang out until they texted us to check in.  Overall, our experience was good, fun and unique. I think that their customer service needs improvement.

1Fbmh1VbbfX8s0nSrxoaSA.text: I had soOoOoOo much fun at Topgolf last night!! My coworkers and I got the shop's rating up to 5 stars on Yelp, so our bosses brought us here for a little celebration. Tbh, I had no idea what to expect at first, but I was blown away! This is def the perfect place for a party or fun "team building" time, even if not everyone is great with a golf club (like myself.)  Upon arrival, you can either valet your car for cheap or park in the front lot as long as there's space - Mind you, we came on a Sunday night (aka the first football Sunday of the season as well as the night Drake is in town) around 9:30/10:00 PM and there was still lots of parking available. There is also a shuttle that comes to/from the MGM, so you could park there as well - although I'm not not sure if parking is still free there or not... (probably not.)  This place is the love child of a day/nightclub and a driving range. Loud music, neon lights, bottle service, and 4 stories to tee off of. There's even a pool (with a swim-up bar, huge-screen tv, & lounge chairs that are partially submerged) that you can chill out in during the day.  The food and drink menu is pretty impressive as well. We all ordered a little bit of everything: Backyard-style wings, grilled edamame, 3 different kinds of pizza, a hoity-toity meat & cheese platter... They were all so good! Def worth the prices because their flavors were fantastic. The drinks were a'flowin' as well. The waiters tending to us were quick on their feet and eager to help too, which is awesome realizing how needy/hungry we all were.  This place does come with a hefty price tag, so I won't be coming here often... which is why I put 4 stars, but I do plan on coming back eventually!! My friends and I would have so much fun here!!

E1cu0fWgKcpOb3wZCnGqsA.text: We had a lot of fun golfing here. We came at 10am on a Wednesday and it was pretty busy, so I imagine it gets pretty nuts during nights and weekends. We wound up playing for an hour and a half total and just ordering some soft drinks, so I can't really comment on the food.   Our server was really nice and helpful, as were all the other staff we interacted with. I'd definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

cJsrRaeI-qfjcBapMesb2Q.text: Price varies on time hitting. We paid 60 for a hour.  Nice idea but if are a bit hitter, then you may be liable for damages if you hit over the fence. Decent price on drinks and food. Great thing is that you have your own server. Giant TV outside the fence area and you can watch in your own stall. Great concept though. If you are in vegas you gotta try it once.

Mq3FolZAj6riGvzFpQSVgA.text: My first experience at topgolf was at the Las Vegas location. It was such a fun experience. It was a pretty cold evening compared to Phoenix and they had large area heaters that warmed up the Bay Area. The food and drinks were great, even for small snack and apps or even a large meal.

O0Pd0bMa3mEwIZp6Zb1MTg.text: This place has a great process if you want to come with a fun group, you should give at least 2 hrs to commit to the experience.  In my opinion the staff in the waiting area are the best however they keep a cute staff of girls serving in the actual driving range areas.  If your really into that no matter what,  you'll enjoy this experience.  If the girl Nikki at the lounge area had stayed with us through out the experience I would have probably given this place a perfect 5 out of 5 which I rarely give however they switched is over to a Barbie with little interest in her guest in my opinion an even less personality or ability to make suggestions or recommendations that could increase your experience.  Regardless this place has a good enough process to ensure everyone leaves happy.  I would definitely recommend to any group.

oifQjCtIoGPz7P6cbOJyZg.text: Super fun place to drink and watch sports with friends. I highly recommend going here when in Vegas!

CBGP6UZfpeXdVi-3kV6KZw.text: **Update** Changed from 2 to 4 stars  I was impressed by the staff after we were seated. Ky was helpful with explaining how everything works, Eva/Lucy were AWESOME, very attentive and checking up on us to make sure we were taken care of. I am happy to say that I will be back for the golfing experience but not so sure abt the bar..   Btw, we ended up leaving a great tip for Eva :)  ================================  I'm here on a mini vacay from Cali.. Heard of this place opened a while back, thought I check it out.  Be advised.. I know its summer in Vegas but with no ceiling fans, it does get a bit hot. Be prepared to play naked!! lol  I came here with 2 buddies on a Sunday. If Im gonna spend $60/hr to hit a few golf balls I expect good service. We had to wait for a spot to open up, so we went to an almost empty bar on the main floor. We sat there for 7 mins (I started a timer) as I watched 2 other groups get served b4 us and still no drinks. We decided to leave the bar.  Will update after if service improves. I mentioned to our host Eva abt our experience.. I guess the tips will go to her instead..

M3MF0RTSXFdq5DYDmdNp5g.text: Not a bad concept for Vegas. A club like sports venue with a pool. 4 levels of driving, 4th level is reserved for private parties. We came here do something fun. For a party of 6 it came about $20 each, not including any drink, food or additional time.  Here's the problem...everything is timed. It's based on hourly price. If you come in early it's not as expensive, the later you show up to drive the more expensive it is. The customer service is ok. The bar service is ok. Yes, the food and drinks are on the high end (not the "buying a brand", more along the lines of Red Robin prices and higher) If you can tolerate the Vegas heat and swing, more power to you. Outdoors is more of a spring/fall sport, which TopGolf falls into.

aXg9FhPfJ6aZQGOBPpAlTw.text: Awesome layout with poolside accommodations while you wait for a lane and a cool concept. My group experienced some issues with the service; forgetting orders, overcrowded bars and too few bartenders. All-in-all, a fun experience but I'd avoid it on the weekends.

Wf76Pz3wn780BqvV_IU2Cg.text: Different experience for the driving range !   You got to try this if you are a golfer in vegas!!!!!

PX8-MsxLLZxZjHi2YMeJYQ.text: We went to see the pink Floyd cover band when we got there we asked to park at the handicap which is the closest to the entrance, the wouldn't let me ,I have a problem walking because I had a knee surgery. The had few available but the parked my car far . When we went to get the car I was waiting for over 20  minutes in pain till my wife spoke to the guy in charge the brought me a chair to seat  .next day we called to speak to a manager, we left  a message, no one called us back. Thank you top golf for taking car of handicap customers.

3Hbu-L4Z4pdKBBvYnOZcaQ.text: TopGolf Vegas is perfect must check out spot if you like Sports, Golf, Drinking, Plenty of TV's and only at this location you have a sports book, video poker at the full bar and rooftop swimming pool. They also stage for live bands and trendy comfortable sitting areas. It's great for groups because the pricing is typical Vegas! Definitely caters to golfing enthusiasts and sports fans.   $8 for beers is not bad for Vegas but $60 for an hour is kinda pricey for the first and second levels during the afternoon. I have not hit golf balls for longest time so I was shanking balls. My experience would be better if they had staff to improve your swing.

k44Bi1Y8O3AsL6bTwImxjg.text: I'm having a hard time rating  Topgolf in Las Vegas. The same time last year I hosted a group of clients and had a great time. This year on 7/1, took out the same clients, had a wonderful time again. They treated us well and our service was awesome. My brother-in-law was in town as well and I recommend Topgolf for a family outing and we went back on 7/6, great time again. Now here is the problem, my wife and I own a dance studio, we are in Las Vegas to compete at a National Dance Competition. We wanted to celebrate with our instructors on a successful week of competition. They all wanted to go TopGolf because they've been hearing great things about it and  it is connected to the MGM where we were staying. On 7/7 @ 9PM we had a reservation for seven or eight people. When we arrived our hostess/waitress wasn't very friendly, not rude but not what I experienced from other hostess on prior visits. She didn't explain anything to our instructors or how things worked with the games. Maybe we caught her on a off night, but whatever, we were there to have a good time. We ordered food and drinks, everything at the start is fine, but I notice our waitress ignoring our group as she walked by multiple times even when they raised their hands to get her attention. My instructors had to start moving plates/glasses and cleaning the table for themselves and trying to find something to wipe their hand on before they pick up a club when it was their turn to hit because there were no napkins on the table ( btw most of Topgolf's menu is finger foods) and she hadn't checked on our party in a very long time. The place wasn't particularly busy that night but still empty bottles, plates, and drinks weren't being cleared off our area. So when she walked by and didn't see our people call to her again, that was it. I pulled her aside and told her she sucked at waitressing and I wanted a new waitress. She of course didn't understand why, so I told her about her lack of service but I also wasn't in the mood to argue so I just I wanted another waitress and to see her manager. A new waitress came but no manager??? The service improved though. Ok good, back to having a good time... as long as my people were having fun, not getting the manger involved I would let pass. When it came to settle the bill, to my surprise the old waitress wanted close us out. Alright, maybe she started the process and the billing system needed her to close the ticket. On the bill I wrote the $100 gratuity goes to the new waitress that gave us great service. Immediately after she ran my ticket she had one of the other employees shut down our game without giving us warning. As far as our group's behavior, we were mild, fun loving, polite as they come. So it was the most bizarre scenario. I directly went and talked to George Kalianiotis the Team Lead and Tiffany Hietbrink the Hospitality Manager about the actions of their vengeful waitress. To both their credit they really tried to make the situation better. But the damage was done and ended our celebratory night at Topgolf on a sour note. By no means am I high roller but if you drop close to $1000 in couple hours you should get at least the same service that you would get from an IHOP. Tiffany and George both gave me their personal card, refunded me back $150 and promised to treat our party right the next time we're in town. I will hold them up to that promise and change my rating then to 5 stars which they deserve except for the action of a waitress having a off night. Joe Espinosa BluJeager Photography The Surge Dance Center

BjkkLOpOXzSjsNjwIk_WdQ.text: All around awesome experience! I was in town for a few days and brought my clubs. Didn't want to spend a whole day at the course but still wanted to hit a few balls. I am so glad I found Top Golf Las Vegas. Once I arrived I saw they offered golf lessons by professional instructors. So I scheduled with the training director Sean Solodovnick. I am relatively new to golf and wanted to rid of all my bad habits I picked up since starting. From the first few swings with Sean's adjustments I could fell the difference in my body mechanics. I went from tight and choppy to lose and smooth in an hour. It went so well I came back a few days later to see him again. Sean made learning the game of golf fun and interesting. He made a difficult task (golf swing) simpler to understand. Sean showed me what was causing my slice, which I could not change on my own. I couldn't be happier with my experience with him. I will definitely be seeing him again and Top Golf my next time in town.

VWAj-GWFICCEdye_Uco9vQ.text: I have been a customer of All Sprinkler for a year and half. The service is extremely reliable. and professional  They are very easy to deal with. I highly recommend All sprinkler based on my experience as a customer.

r998Mtm-Z92k2piEIIf-Hw.text: Top Golf in Las Vegas is unlike any other golf experience you may have experienced. It's location alone is perfect. Located right behind planet Hollywood makes it an easy to walk from the strip or a quick Uber drive. In my opinion it's best to go at dusk when all the lights of the strip are illuminated. You are in the heart of the strip while you play golf making for a spectacular ambience. This is a great place for families, date nights, Bachelor parties, or large gatherings with friends. If there is a sports game, match, or fight on this would also be an amazing place to come and view it because they have multiple TVs for your viewing pleasure. Including a ginormous wall projection located in the middle of the place and easily seen from mult levels. Not only can you play an array of golf games but you can also play bean bag games, table tennis or even take a quick dip in the pool. There is something for everyone in your party. Top golf even serves out killer food and drinks. For those 21 and over I highly recommend the frozen Moscow mule! It's delicious and ideal for fighting the Vegas heat. If you're hungry grab the chicken Boursin bacon flatbread, pulled pork sliders or the House marinated steak kabobs. You'll be blown away by quality of the food. I'm a local and have visited this establishment many times and have always had a beyond pleasant experience, great service, and outstanding dining. If you're looking for a good time while in town make sure to stop by top golf Las Vegas!!

K3S6_9rEbaMM6p0wFrv2WQ.text: I suck at golf, but none of that matters when you have the classy ambience of this place and good company.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nsP_FTyHq89lDh5hkXoX4Q.text: Fun place to come to with friends. I went in and they weren't very good at explaining everything to it was a bit confusing at first. The explanation could've been better but overall had a great time

ZzjH0YiiJFCwDcvClRhvAA.text: In town for Keller Williams Family Reunion and decided to try something different for our team dinner. Top Golf was great. Staff was exceptional and very friendly. Would highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JEVVi9hLArHsnNHHO2NWiw.text: It was an okay experience. Liked that the balls has gps embedded. The venue itself was like a cleaner sleeker driving range with monitors. We got situated all the way across from the pool. Only saw a few people using it.  The costs can add up quick as this feels like they are nickel and diming. We stayed for an hour in the 3rd floor. $60 + $5 membership fee per player. Got 3 drinks. Total was roughly $100.  The bay allows for up to 6 players, so you can minimize cost that way, but that just means less golf time per player.

FtAshJMjIr3G6HLrhgMq4g.text: Celebrated a friends birthday and the atmosphere was great. Nice overall setting. I am not a golfer, but it was fun attempting to play while big screen TVs are ahead of you. The prices are reasonable for an outing, the drinks are ok, but a little overpriced. They do serve food as well, but I didn't try it this time. It is likely that I will return to play golf again.

Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Jalapeño Margarita....Tasty! Had more of a jalapeño flavor over the strawberry and the cost was $15

eftcG3W2ZSux06EBVl5PIQ.text: Once you can get past the front check in people top golf is a 5 star place. The service at check-in, over the phone, and at reservations are what kill this place. I tried to reserve a bay for a bachelor party and for over a week no-one answered the phone or returned messages. When I went in to make the reservation in person, the fees were crazy. Reservations were limited to level 3 & 4, a bay fee of $105 per hour (that is the peak hour fee & is $10 more than the posted walk-in rates) with a $250-350 F&B minimum depending on who you talk to. On top of that, they charge an extra 7% service charge on your bill for using a reserved bay! That's crazy!  Obviously decided to forgo the reservation and just had one of the people in our group volunteer to come earlier to put our name down for a bay. Ended up getting our bay after waiting a little over an hour. The servers at the Birdie Bar were fantastic in taking our orders and transferring them to our bay once we got one. Once we got to our bay, the staff was just as great. The food was better than we expected and like I said earlier, the experience once we got past the front was 5 stars.

l_Z0e6UDlH8ZLP2A-7efyg.text: We had to wait about 2-3 hours before they had a spot available for us, but it wasn't that far of a walk to MGM to play some slots in the meantime. I think they texted us when they were ready. We had a lot of fun! Most of our group had never hit anything with a golf club before, but they got the hang of it quickly. Fun daytime activity. Staff was super nice, and drinks were tasty.

AM5_tXN541AqAxPCqliZzQ.text: As a local, this was the first time I have played TopGolf in Las Vegas. My son-in-law was in town from Seattle and wanted to go. We walked up with no reservation and had a slot on level one within 15 minutes. It was fun. I will be going back and in fact I will probably be hosting future events for a group of my Vegas Bros.  I brought my own driver and used the house provided drivers for our chipping game.  Our server Jewell was the best. She really stood out for her attentiveness and her sincere friendliness plus she laughed at my jokes. She is why I gave you 5 stars when it should have been 4 stars based on the following:  108 climate-controlled hitting bays - There are these vents slightly behind the booth blowing air. Not cold air. Just air. I asked a number of the staff why the air was not cold and was told it was hit or miss. And the excuse that the air was warm because it is hot out is the wrong answer. Of course it is hot out, it's Vegas in the summer. Please define "climate controlled". Needs to be cold air. #HVAC  I think TopGolf needs to have a locals discount. You are making plenty of money off of tourists. If you want more locals to return more often, $28 pitchers of beer does not cut it or at least offer locals hitting bay discounts during non-peak times.

JVOxHzPz7EXBfDqiSwNokA.text: A new way to enjoy drinking and games! They've taken the driving range to another level. It's like ordering bottle service and challenging your friends on the driving range. You play by points on where the ball lands in these lit up circles. You get this incredible view of Vegas and you get to golf it up. This place gets really popular at night. So be prepared to wait. The 3rd floor also has cabanas and a pool to swim. It still has some kinks to work out but it's still fun nonetheless. I would recommend this place for a fun drinking activity with a group of friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GATi1mjBuzYyvQ_MJRKMwg.text: We had a great time on Saturday for a friend's birthday. The views are amazing and we had so much fun. The atmosphere was great and I was surprised to see there was more than just golf. There's a pool, great food, great music, and even a magician. The magician showed us some incredible tricks while we waited for our table.  He somehow knew the card my friend was thinking of before she said it! He blew our minds. The drinks were really tasty and the server was very attentive to our table. The wings were delicious. I definitely can not wait to go back.

hDApDKcyUZA2bTnt2PJQEA.text: So much fun. Kinda pricey food but you definitely get what you pay for. I suck at golfing but I can wack a ball all day! Super fun for all ages.

nLVtWh1MKngl3yi_yB4Y4A.text: Touchdown!? Errr... I have zero love for the actual game of golf, but get me in a driving range and I'm having a blast. Topgolf is truly the ultimate driving range with multiple targets within the range that capture your yardage and speed.   4 levels high, this massive play house is balls of fun! You enter on the second level where you check-in. We got super lucky, as I have heard many a horror story about the massive weight times. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND calling ahead. We waited about 10 minutes and then received a text that our golf bay was ready. Prices are per hour and vary by the time you arrive and which level you would like to be on, obviously nighttime and the higher levels are more mula! There is also a one-time $5 per person for a Topgolf Lifetime Membership. I'm in the club, baby!!  The 4th level is a private event space with a private pool. We opted for the 3rd level because YOLO. The 3rd level has a private bar and a pool. This level is cool because it can please a whole crowd, some can be at the pool and some can be at hitting balls-- you can easily go back and forth. Typically the pool on level 3 is $30/person to use, but if you are spending mad money at your table and it isn't CRAZY busy at the pool-- they are pretty cool about letting you in. There is about 6 cabanas surrounding the pool that you can rent, 3 of which "overlook" Wet Republic.   Similar to bowling, your group gets their own "lane." They call it a "golf bay," I like to call it a golf cabana because it sounds fancy. We had 5 people, but I think you could fit 8-10 in a lane. Your golf cabana contains 2 TVs (one with your golf scores + one with sports), a sectional couch, a table, space to put your own clubs, the Topgolf clubs that are offered to you (for men and women), the grass patch with tees and the machine that spits out the balls. A host walked us to the golf cabana and explained the process. They really push the "No Happy Gilmoring." You are then handed off to a server who can get your food and drink orders. I had a frozen Ketle One moscow mule and it was perfection. #STRONG  There are multiple games you can play within the targets on the range. You start by waving your club in front of the ball machine sensor and poof-- your ball. You get 20 balls per person per game. However, you can complete multiple games in an hour. We played for 2 hours and it felt too long. haha But, that might just be me. The screen will tell you how far and fast you hit the ball ONLY if you make it in a target. There are 4 big targets and another 4 small ones.   I can see the appeal of this place and I enjoyed watching friends who love golf getting excited. However, personally if this was near my house-- it wouldn't be my go-to place. It is expensive and while fun, I think there are better places to have fun for the price. With that being said, it is definitely worth at least one trip.   The parking/taxi/valet situation can be a shit-show and is something I think still needs to be worked out at this location.

Rl-kQAGlwCuvWqhbfc4qwQ.text: Had a blast here! First time here. Love the atmosphere. Staff was nice and friendly and the people playing are fun as well....

ISKrflLwmpOXdAOMOICm3Q.text: Great venue to hang out at besides the cash in in Vegas. 4 star because it was a 3 hour wait for a bay! A bay fits up to 10 people, and can have up to 6 players at a time. The drinks and food are decently priced. I had a golf bag drink, tastes good and the injectable doughnut holes, interesting concept, choose your flavor and you put as much filling in them as you'd like.  There are free games around while you wait like corn hole and Jenga. They have multiple levels. 2 levels have a pool on them and I was another level with a dj and dance area.

MCdX2hWbQtl4XbU1XENqlg.text: In the last couple months I've made my back to Top Golf a few times. Best time of the year to visit would be Spring and Fall. Summer is still a great time to visit if you don't mind the heat. I suggest night golfing if you want to avoid the sun. There's 3 levels of golf, a pool area during the day, and gaming. The main floor has two huge TV's. We loved it for a place to go watch sports and lounge. It's can be a friendly spot for families as well! This venue is a great spot-unfortunately, the service isn't what I hoped. Otherwise, i would give Top Golf a 5 Star review.

zZPdNI-jD5111jTYHSrj3w.text: My friends and I always have a good time when we come since we're locals- our host DJ always sets us up.  It's a nice low key spot if you want to have a few drinks and good food while working on your swing, I've heard the line can be some what of a wait (2+hrs) so if you have a group of 5 or more I'd suggest just everyone pitching in and getting the cabana area on the 3rd level. My favorite server would have to be Andi she was super sweet and always came to check up on us to see if we were OK. The BBQ platter is a must try and seasonal parfait is a great dessert item too! But the best dessert is the injectable cinnamon ball things, they can get messy but worth it. Security can be a little touchy but I guess they kind of have to be up tight since there's alcohol involved balls and metal clubs...

jRtg6NewmZnJ98P8HBrd6Q.text: This place sucks. It has such a big hype for nothing. Their drinks come in plastic cups..... But the kind that makes your drink taste disgusting. Even just an ice water is nasty. Beer is pretty much served warm. Who wants to drink a warm beer?  There's hidden fees. They are very deceiving when giving out info. Customer service is whack!  Here we go: We planned to come here for my bro in law's bday. My sister was having such a hard time calling to get info on if we should or even could make reservations or not.  Even customer service on the phone sucked. We couldn't get solid answers for anything.  We ended up just showing up and getting on the wait list. We had about 10 people expected to come. My sister ask 1 girl how big each bay was... The girl showed her how big and she was pretty satisfied about it....... Until we got seated and it wasn't nearly as big as the girl told her! It was actually about half the size!  It was $75/HR for that half bay which could supposedly sit 10 people. (Yeah, if we sit on each other's laps!!!). We sat down and found out that each person has to pay an additional $5 if they want to golf.. I get it, it's only $5. BUT why didn't anyone tell us this from the beginning?   We spoke to so many people and no one mentioned extra fees to play.  Sooooo you pretty much just reserve a spot in front of a golf ball and golf clubs BUT you can't actually play until you pay more than the $75/HR you're already paying. Then we ordered drinks..... They showed us the drink menu and we almost got the bottle service. As we were sitting to discuss we had a server (Eva I think? And some other guy..) we couldn't even really discuss amongst ourselves if we wanted the bottle service because 2 people in the group were trying to sign up to play with one of the workers (and pay their extra $5) and the rest of us were debating on the drinks. Ultimately, it was the approach of the workers that made it feel disorganized.  They stood there and stared as we tried to decide. I had to tell them that we needed a minute so they could get out of our faces. We later decided to order our drinks.  They came out fairly quickly but again.. They were all WARM. The prices are through the roof at this place. Yes, it's a gorgeous view and pretty cool atmosphere, but most definitely not worth any of the cost what so ever. My husband ordered chicken wings that everyone could share but we didn't get any plates. We just had to pass around the serving dish and eat out of it until we could flag our waitress down for some plates. When it came closer to our hour they asked if we wanted to extend for an extra hour. By that time our mood was at the point of annoyed and we tried to figure out if we should go somewhere else. We had about EIGHT minutes left in the hour.. We were told if we don't decide if we want to extend the hour we have to move all our stuff and finish the rest of our food somewhere on the side of the building. Are. You. Kidding. Me?!! The absolute WORST service ever!  Whoever is in charge of training the staff should be terminated immediately. They have absolutely no idea what is going on, they do not know how to answer questions, or they're all just idiots. Oh! To end the night off we had to wait 837363836374 hours for our car in valet. (Which by the way is your only option to park unless you want to walk from MGM.) Top golf...  You're a joke.

ce5a9KVDRd3b-pPT0OKrSg.text: My private lesson at Topgolf was amazing! This was my first (real) time golfing. I had been to topgolf two other times but literally had no idea what I was doing. I just grabbed a club and swung. My fiance loves to golf, and he wanted me to love it too. That way, we could do it together. So, he bought me a private lesson for my birthday ($99 cost). It was so worth it.   My instructor was Brandon Johnson. He is a top-notch instructor. In one hour, he turned my swing-and-miss to a real swing of which I can be proud, especially for a beginner. Brandon did a great job explaining things in a way that clicks. He didn't overcomplicate things, he broke it down to chewable details, and built a great foundation for my golfing future. My favorite thing about Brandon's coaching style is that he could easily explain to me what I did on each shot form-wise that led to the ball going different ways. Furthermore, the nice thing was that I brought my new club set (another birthday gift), and so I was able to practice on my own clubs.   I highly recommend hiring Brandon as your instructor. It was such a great experience. My fiance was able to hang out (sipping sangria) and watch my lesson in our booth area. Topgolf's fun atmosphere is the best place to get started for a newbie.  I can't wait to go back!

S0tkwhxEHGKyUMbjzqD_jg.text: I have had 3 out of my 4 experiences at this place being terrible.  They make it incredibly difficult to get your locals discount, or forget it each time... check your bill at the end.   the waitress accidentally gave us 2 drinks of the same thing. When we explained what happened they took it away, but still charged us for it on the bill.   I give 2 stars because the concept is fun, but the service has been bottom quality.

xZKPDr-4E-w-zfOaLvVB4A.text: The food was ok. Menu looked pretty good but this is really a review on the weak service. Sat at bar for lite lunch and had to get the bartenders attention a few times for another drink and a water. They spent a lot of time walking in circles around bar but with head down not looking at customers and their drink status. If I have an empty water glass and you walk past 7 times without looking at me then there is a problem. It was not even busy and it was pitiful that I had to wave or call out to them to get service. Needs to be better than this.

XNMCV83x0KjZpKrGsRtEBQ.text: LOVED the experience. I wish they had one in CA. For start, I have never played golf in my entire life where as my bf is a pro golfer and we both ended up having a great time. We got the 2nd deck for an hour in the afternoon. It was around $60 an hour but we had to pay $5pp one time (initiation fee? ) which was not bad for the service and location. The bigger group might need more hours as the time flies by quickly.  Next time, we will definitely try their 3rd level with swimming pool and hot tub. Although we didn't order much there seems to have a huge selection of food and drinks. All the staff were very friendly.

CYaAbjXv89Cy4MYMJASAyA.text: I was reluctant to go to an outdoor driving range in 98 degree heat, but I went with a group of friends in the evening.  When we arrived we gave our name at the front desk and they said they would text is when our spot was ready. We were told about 30 min. An hour went by, so we went to the front desk. They said they texted us 30 min in, but we never received it, and we did verify the phone number. I don't know why they just don't announce your name over the loud speaker. A simple system made complicated.  Finally we get to our spot and settle in. It was a little loud, but the attendant gave us a good amount of info. The balls are tracked and scored by radar. The attendant told us the different games are in the menu book. The games were listed but the rules and instructions were not. It was very hard to figure out on our own. The computer does not give you the objectives, it just tells you when its your turn.   The clubs in each spot are labeled mens and womens. Mens clubs are longer with steel shafts while the womens are shorter with graphite shafts. They were in good shape and clean. The balls are released by covering a laser eye. The roll out onto the mat, if you want to tee it up you have to do it yourself. You pay by the hour so you can hit as many balls as you can crank out in the time period. You can add more time as you go right from the computer screen.  My biggest gripe, besides waiting longer than we should have, is that the radar didn't away work. Sometimes it didnt score the shot correctly and sometimes is didnt read the ball at all. If the radar worked as it should, we all would have had a much better time.  All in all we had a good time. Each area had a fan and a water mister so it wasnt too hot, and the cold air duct with push out some cold air on intervals to help with the heat. The bar service was prompt and friendly. Make sure you ask lots of questions about the computer system.

2mOfBSjPIED6DVrBU0lRtg.text: We play at Top Golf every time we visit Vegas. My sister-in-law purchased a summer pass from a TopGolf in Oklahoma. She called the Vegas location to be sure there were no restrictions on the pass play. When we visited on June 10th we were told that the pass had restrictions on the tier level play. We asked to speak to the manager and we were very pleased when the manager Miguel helped us. He even escorted us to our bay. It was such wonderful customer service! Kudos to Miguel and to Top Golf!

5U8ZJknVRiScPyRe51bqJg.text: This place is pretty rad. Def better than topgolf Atlanta. You could spend a pretty awesome afternoon/evening here and not even golf, that's how many activities they have. Cornhole, pong, TWO pools, tv's everywhere, multiple bars... all the things. Oh yea, the topgolf system is fun too (target/point based games against your friends). It's pricey, sure. Don't come here if you want to practice your swing and think it's a driving range facsimile, it's not. Don't get me wrong, it's fun for any level of golfer, but you're not taking your time and getting $5 buckets here. Overall, a great night out with (competitive) friends. Emphasis on night out. Bonus: employees were helpful and super friendly.  Note: do not dizzy from the top decks

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome views

TrKzzBqBW2TP1ADdr_wtOA.text: This place was great we had so much fun here. We were in Vegas for the week and the only day they had available was Tuesday. Every other day was booked with private events, even the day we went they only had the first floor available. The third floor is for adults only but luckily there were no kids where we were playing. Our wait was an hour and a half which was fine because they have so much you can do while you wait. They have games to play, plenty of huge tv's to watch, plenty of places to lounge with optional heaters. The staff here is very helpful and friendly, they explained everything to us thoroughly. Their prices are pretty high, we played for an hour which was good since it was just two of us. They do give you options to buy more time in 30 minute increments. The drinks were strong and the food was good. The short rib tacos were flavored well and the injectable donut holes were also pretty strong, lol. You will have to pay a one time membership fee of five dollars and if you complete a first time survey they will give you a discount for a future visit. Since they are starting to pop up in more states we will definitely be returning because it's really a good time with a group or just a date night.

BEnF9nFfp5TjcgpQ6ieeyg.text: It's always a good time when we come here! And it's not pricey, if you split cost between friends. Good food and drinks! Only thing I wouldn't do, is play golf on the 1st level! It's flat and not as fun as if you were on the other two levels playing.

IcGHFYD2VwwWLOypFW8EoQ.text: Update: contacted the Mgt. team at Topgolf and sent a copy of my receipt with the overcharge on it. After a week of them investigating I was given a refund for the overcharged amount. Somehow I was charged for an extra half an hour of play and I didn't notice it at the time I paid the bill.  I will definitely come back. They could have told me too bad. I mean, honestly they are constantly busy and me not coming 3-4 times a year wouldn't hurt their business at all. It says something that they saw my review, reached out, and made it right. I had a great time there, my server Kristi was awesome, and it was fun just blasting balls off the second floor.  Glad I can return without a chip on my shoulder!

PqQyEDxTagbZlhMGU-YWOw.text: WOW!!! Came to Vegas to tie the knot Did a pre wedding grooms party here and could not have been more impressed. Our ambassador William was very professional and personable. And our server AnnaMae was able to assist our every need. Love the instant replay and the HUGE screens at the end of the range.

HIpxI1Rni27qP-GJGnsYGg.text: The booze is way over priced and the food is okay priced but mediocre. The 7 layer bean dip had cheese on the top that I could have bought at Vons. But more importantly, it's in the middle of summer and they don't have the misters on. I'm writing this as of June 19 IN VEGAS. LIKE REALLY. I'm sweating more than a sorority girl in a frat house. Management said they don't turn them on "until it's way over 100 degrees." What a bunch of idiots. People start dying of sweat at 85 degrees in Vegas. Exactly what happens when you have out of towers come into Vegas thinking they know how to run a hospitality business. Oh and the tortilla chips suck. Hit me up if you want some real expertise.

9h_CI-ASGdH4K8huzi77Ew.text: In town visiting thought I'd check out the most talked about place in town, long story short WORST service ever hands down Amy V was our server on the second level. She came and went so fast I could hardly ask her anything about the menu, ordered drinks from her took about 10-15 minutes for those to come they were just beers. My friend asked for a glass she never brought it so they went to the bar themselves and got it because she was busy talking to her co-worker right behind our table. Anyways ordered the food, food comes out it was a little cold could we tell her no because she didn't come back and check on us once, beers gone... annoyed we asked for the check thank god I had a gift card that we used for this adventure because I would have been pissed if I spent $117

NGpEIyEt120XVmuahVcg0g.text: Dominic, sara, and florin we're some of the best Hostess experience that Vegas can offer, woah! Definitely a bonus if you book a private booth ahead of time, but still a few hundreds but totally worth it with this level of customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_DVufJYwG5WOn9wbUVJ2OQ.text: First time at Top Golf and I loved it. And especially the Vegas location- from what I gather this is like the Top Golf to top all Top Golfs (see what I did there?) But seriously - sports books and slots if you want to gamble. Live music almost every day. Massive tv screens. And three floors worth of golfing + drinking + eating goodness to enjoy.   Expect a wait - we waited around an hour and a half. But you can put your name down and leave or just hang out and drink. So it's really not too bad. I'm not super into golf but the fact that the ball just spits right out makes it so easy to want to swing for an hour or so. After that it got a little boring. My fiance is a pretty intense golfer and could have probably paid to stay all day but around an hour was plenty of time. Plus it adds up. Price is something like a dollar a minute. But hey, money is better spent here than it is at the tables. They have a large food and drink menu and each bay has waiter service so you can continue to order while you play. Each bay also has a tv ! We didn't eat but the food around us looked dope.   If you are into golf + sports betting this is basically one of the happiest places on earth for you. These are two of my fiance's favorite things and he was like a kid in a candy store. Make sure to stop on by if you are looking for something different to do while in Vegas!

_va3vDMN7SAGZmSovS8J0A.text: I came here on a Sunday night around 10pm and waited about 10-15 minutes for a group of 8. We ordered two pitchers of beer, sweet potato waffle fries, regular fries and tater tots. The food that we ordered was just ok, nothing too special about it. It might not be the best place to eat, but it is a great place to celebrate birthdays! It's nice that you have your is area with a comfy couch and table that you can order drinks and food from, while playing golf without purchasing a table/getting bottle service like you have to do at a club. We didn't get any birthday package or anything, but I went up to get shots for the group to celebrate my boyfriends birthday at 12am. I went up to the bar a few minutes before 12, ordered, and asked if they could deliver the drinks at 11:59pm as a surprise. I didn't expect them to do anything extra and it was really nice of them to do that for me! They brought it out at exactly 11:59 like I asked and even threw in the happy birthday sign with flashing lights to make it even more special and celebratory! I didn't ask for this at all so it was really nice of them to do this since I  wasn't buying a bottle or anything. Ruben was the host who brought out the drinks and the sign and he was awesome!! We also got some complimentary donut holes for his birthday! Thank you Topgolf and Ruben, for making my boyfriend's birthday an amazing one!

zhGX_WMTYV4JMkwG79qdjw.text: Waited nearly 2 hours for a bay on the 2nd floor.  Poor customer service. Told that it would be 30 minute wait for the  3rd floor. Someone messed up and then they did not attempt to make it better in the slightest.  Its expensive and not worth the long wait. If I had known that we wouldn't get a spot for an hour and 45 minutes. I would of done something else!!!

zu_3Bcp9B3WJgtvHdnUGgw.text: Whether you're a complete newbie or a seasoned golfer, TopGolf is a ton of fun.    THE SETUP:  TopGolf is basically a three-level driving range with a variety of targets and with big screens (like the size they have at a large arena or stadium) showing sports on the far side.  Each bay has an l-shaped seating area, a table, TVs coordinated to track your drives, and the actual golfing area which has an automatic ball machine and a full set of clubs (lefty clubs are available by request).  Each pair of bays face each other.   As each bay accommodates 6 golfers, groups of up to 12 can use two side-by-side bays.    PRICING: The golfing is actually pretty inexpensive.  If you go midweek and before noon, you can get a bay for as cheap as $30/hour (plus a $5 member fee for each person).  Friday/Saturday nights can go for as much as $90/hour.  You can find discount vouchers from the booth in the lobby of the MGM, and don't need to do full hour increments (we ended up golfing for an hour and a half).    FOOD/DRINK:  Food and drink are really the way TopGolf makes its money.  Beers start at $7 each and bottle service starts at $300.  The best values are getting Beer for the Bay ($24 beers for $150) and getting shareable platters rather than individual dishes.  Our group came for breakfast/brunch and shared the street taco platter ($75) and the fruit platter ($65).  The food was much fresher and better than expected especially the carnitas tacos, and came with grilled onions, chips, salsa, pickled vegetables, peppers, and guacamole.  I also enjoyed the manmosa (Blue Moon, prosecco, and OJ) for $10.  You can spend a ton of money here but you don't have to.

pLvr0JuxI9iQX3cVFwF_0A.text: This place is really fun to be at! We have a 10 month old and it was a nice place to find in vegas that is baby friendly. People were friendly and the view was amazing.

cUJEFTghzkT5X2a_8Q8hpg.text: This place is just OK. Maybe I expected a lot more because there was so much hype about it, but I really don't get it. It's very average. The biggest issue I found, as a local, is that they do not have valet car service. Finding parking is incredibly difficult, if not impossible, on a busy night. They tell you to go parking at MGM which I think is ridiculous. Therefore, if you are going to come here, doing a cab or Uber/ Lyft is a good idea. Everyone says the inside is gorgeous. The inside is average. It's just OK. I actually found it somewhat basic and boring. We were in a party where there was a buffet ordered of pastas, salad, and also a few starters in the barbecue realm. This was behind the seat/couches we were on, and it was very difficult to eat. We found it very inefficient. If you love golf, I guess you'll really like this place. I am not a huge fan so everything else has to wow me and it did not. Drinks also average.  Glad I came and saw. Would not push to come back. Way better places in Vegas with better deals and better fun.

k3UUy-MtjW8AKJpH37wuuw.text: **This review is for the Comedy Club** I've never been to top golf to play golf, but as soon as I was notified that Benji Aflalo would be performing, I bought tickets. I HAD SO MUCH FUN! I love that I can see a comedy show here for such a great price too.   Once we got inside, we were seated by a hostess with long black hair and she was so nice (forgot her name), if she could be recognized I would really appreciated it. We saw Benji on the Friday , his opening night.  They offer you a food menu and a drink menu. I wish I would have known because we ate before, but now we know for next time.   Get there early if you want to have a good seat because it's kind of limited and it's all long dining tables so it works better if you're coming with friends.   This place is awesome! Please continue to book great acts like Benji!!

uqIrRPS3G9n-YC6ZmXuW6A.text: This was by far the worst experience I've had at top golf. As locals who live in the city this experience does not make locals want to come to the strip at all. Not only did we wait over an hour for nachos but our wait staff only came by once in a two hour period. Then there was an event tent set up so we had to park at mgm and walk with signs at top golf saying they would validate our ticket for free parking. We did what was asked and got the ticket validated however the mgm garage staff wanted to charge us 15.00 for parking stating there were only two options....one to pay or the other to go through as a no pay which flags the license plate. This is the worst experience as a local that I've ever had and the second horrible experience I've had at this top golf location. We WILL NOT return. Which I know they don't care because they just care about getting their money.  This email is a service from Topgolf. [R5OKRE-ME5R]

oLQCtFruy0Z2d4j7DLWeVQ.text: This place is pretty balling! My group got to Top Golf before our reservation time and had about 30 mins to kill. The place is pretty big with plenty of space to pass the time by playing shuffleboard, corn hole, or just watching some sports from their many TVs along with the bar. The atmosphere was great.   The golfing part was also very fun as they had many game options to play and everyone in my group, both beginners and amateurs, all had a great time. I will say it could have been better if our bay was more centered because being on the edge bay made it somewhat harder to aim the ball.  Staff members are exceptional and were a big plus in the overall experience. The beer selections are plenty and the food snacks were way better than I was expecting!  The difference in price between playing mid-morning and late afternoon and later is noticeable, and I would definitely recommend playing in the morning so then you can do other Late Night Vegas activities =) .

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Playing!
Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snacking!

T8_inU3TUSb7YKzJe5wBuA.text: There's almost no way anyone can come here and not have a good time. The place is just cool, whether you play golf or not.   This was my first time checking it out and I was impressed by the sheer size of it. Sure, it's pretty cool hitting some golf balls while lounging in your own personal bay with food and beverage service. But there are so many other things things you can do even if you don't know how to swing a golf club. Most surprisingly, the food that we tried was actually pretty good and a notch above your typical bar food.  My only complaint is the generic Top Golf clubs that they provide. I get that they can't offer actual nice clubs for all the drunk/beginner action that they see, but these things were like janky little junior sets you'd find at KMart. Not that it really matters after 2 or 5 drinks. Good times.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi tacos.

m7IwQMzxJIxyKhPBMrOkZQ.text: Top golfs have been blowing up everywhere and this was the third time I've actually been to the one in Las Vegas. The main reason for going was it was the celebration for our friends birthday party so we reserved six bays. Note,  when you reserve a bay you want to be in the middle and possibly off the ground floor, unfortunately, this time our party was 201-206 which if you know Topgolf means the far left corner on the second floor. The catered food was sat out for us which include a barbecue brisket mac & cheese links chicken wings and some other sides to complement the meal which I believe were nachos and chips  The staff members helping us we're pretty good as far as getting us anything as well as securing beverages for us but we really didn't get a chance to enjoy the game as much as I hope because we were in the far corner. If you like swinging, hitting from the far corner and hitting certain targets is a lot harder than it is when you're in the center of the Top Golf.   The other thing that wasn't so great was that as a frequent top golf member I couldn't add myself (my profile) because it was set up as a group event. But I struggled a bit with that because I've done that in the past for other groups and been able to modify and add my profile.   Overall a decent experience but I think they're so much more Las Vegas to do. If you don't have a Topgolf near you then yes I would definitely recommend going because the vibe is cool & the swimming pool upstairs is dope. It's a nice addition to have and the location is not far from the strip, but not a place to really put in work and party. More of a pit stop before you get into some real shenanigans! Drinks are pricey and not strong (made by the book). Worth coming back again with a group but lots of other activities to consider.

Uh5m1_61tkBccNIjbTfZRg.text: As expected Vegas location cost 3x that of Pheonix.  Nice time with 3 decks but don't recommend being on deck 1 - more fun being elevated and i think the ball goes further :). Didn't order food. They said wait to play would be 30 min and it only took 5 so don't waste the $50 to make a reservation. Wednesday offers buy 1 hour get 1 free by Hertz - was only way i could swallow the $62/hr per bay cost. Candy crush golf game Was the most fun and staff was a delight. Walking distance from mgm Grand and Marriott or Hilton Vacation Clubs.

QK581j47mB4TTDXVEzACyA.text: Topgolf is always a good time! We enjoy going with groups or just the two of us for some relaxed atmosphere and friendly competition.   Some faves from the bar include the Mai Tai, Spicy Bloody Mary, and frozen Moscow mule- perfect for summer!   Food faves include the chicken bacon flatbread, breakfast sandwich, and their house salad is pretty tasty and unique! The radishes and cucumbers are thin sliced, lots of heirloom cherry tomatoes, and a one of a kind delicious vinaigrette. Sooo good!   Even though the third deck is a bit more expensive, I definitely recommend paying the difference if the adults only vibe is important to you; it's worth it. Also- they have a locals discount on gameplay with ID! Don't miss out on that perk.

OHMTh-i0Dw_OlXv5MI-eDw.text: This place is crazy fun with so much to do. BUT like everything else in Vegas, expect to be spending quite a bit to get the whole experience.   Boyfriend and I have always wanted to go to Top Golf, but the closest one to us is in Roseville , CA that is 2 hours away from us. But since we were in Vegas and not doing anything that day, we decided to go here.   It was a Saturday & it's summer so we knew it was going to be a little bit crowded and prices were going to be a little up there. At first if you are on the website and looking to reserve a bay, it may say its sold out , so assuming because it was Saturday, summer, being in Vegas , I would look ahead of time on the website if you want to reserve a bay.   BUT most of the time they do have walk in bays set aside for all the walk ins that come in , which is really convenient being that we didn't even think we were going to be able to go to Top Golf anymore because of the website.   We arrived there around 2ish and it was actually pretty busy with tons of people still walking in. The line wasn't bad at all though it just looked super busy. The desk ladies let us know that bays on the 1-2 floor were about an 30min-1 hour wait and if you wanted to go to the 3rd floor it was an hour and a half. We decided to just do the 1-2 floor since it was just our first time.   Prices also vary from times that you go in , on a Saturday from afternoon-5pm it's about $77 per hour and after 8pm it was around $80 per hour. If you look online it can tell you dates on the weekdays which are a bit cheaper.   My boyfriend, friends and I waited pretty much less than 30 minutes and we already got to our bay which was still beautiful with the Vegas strip right behind it , which I'm sure is even more beautiful at night with all the lights.   The guy pretty much explained everything for us from which golf clubs are for the ladies, which ones are for the guys, and how to put all the information we need for the game. The servers were great too and very efficient with serving us right away with water , drinks, and any food we decided to get during our game.   I decided to get the Sunrise burger and stuffed donuts. The Sunrise burger was really good ,but not something I would exactly hype but still good. The real excitement was for the stuffed donuts since you got the chance to stuff them on your own with the syringes that came with vanilla and chocolate. It was a little messy since it is 100 degrees outside but honestly if you are at Top Golf , I feel like the stuffed donuts were one of the things on the menu to def try while there.   Overall the whole experience was fun and quite relaxing on a Saturday afternoon. Good music, fun game, good food, and good people to be around with.   The only thing I probably advise while going here is to go with a group of friends and to keep in mind of how pricy it can get when playing the game. Which we ended up paying a total of around $200 for an hour and half split between 4 of us. So it Top Golf is def a place to go with a big group of friends. (At least 6 of you to play)   I'm assuming it would be different at the Roseville location , but still plan on going for my boyfriends birthday now since he loves this place.

mabYdm_-9p1NxNJYne2JKQ.text: Great experience at this fully serviced driving range. You can choose from 3 levels (first 2 levels are one price, 3rd level is a bit more). Your assigned "bay" comes complete with comfy couches, assortment of clubs (men's and women's), touch screens to operate the different games/score keeper, a menu with drinks and food, a wonderful server, and most importantly on 40 degree (C) days like today, fans and misters!  Golf balls are dispensed automatically, with a wave of your club, and depending on where your ball lands in the various targets (almost like a dartboard system) you get different points based on that. If you swing for the fences and hit the back wall (in the centre), you get mega points!  Great place to hang out with friends/family, entertain clients, etc. Definitely check this place out!

4Ue21QK_amuh5m-m0YRV8w.text: FIVE FUCIING STARS!!! I truly had the BEST time at topgolf. We were with a big group and we enjoyed everything. Tyw lounge before getting our bay, the arcade, the pool, the big screens and let alone the golf bay itself. It was super fun and highly recommended.

mtfgEH8M_aIH5_kquYQTFw.text: I'm here often for comedy. I always have a good time. Sometimes the comics bomb but even then I have a good time.   My friends and I always have a good time when we go. The drinks are good and a bit strong as I was told by my friends. Most seats are good, just steer clear of those behind the post. It gave me a neck ache but still had a good time. I was excited to see one of my friends win an hour of golf.   You can watch tv and play games which is great because you can just have a good time with friends. The atmosphere is fun.

iU2OpK_DndDw9zXMfSinLg.text: On a very hot August day we checked out Top Golf. It's way cool. We talked to the desk clerk about the concept. The fees are for an hour of unlimited balls. You can practice or choose one of many games. The balls have chips that measure distance, speed, curve, etc. Water mist fills the air in your space since you hit from outside. A TV screen keeps track of all players scores, similar to a bowling chart. Several restaurants have food and craft beers. A pool is on the top floor to extend your par-tee. A gift shop has nice clothes and trinkets.

RwrBUc9JEkj9kIRIyci1Dg.text: This was my first time at a this place.  First off, I'm not a golfer in any way, shape, or form.  But I had a blast at their driving range.  The environment is fun and exciting.  They have huge TV screens everywhere in their enormous lounge.    Whether, your golfing, or just hanging out, you'll never be bored at this place.  And they honor military/law enforcement/first responders.  (woo hoo!!). Hats off to this place.  I will definitely come back to this place the next time I'm in Vegas.

ewAUUa4HvyNoNhx4xOYO6w.text: Super fun place to test out your golfing skills!  A nice addition to the Vegas strip since it provides an extra alternative to gambling or dayclubbing in 100 degree heat in the summer. Uber would be easiest to get here, but they have shuttles running from MGM also.  If you're concerned about hourly rates, it's best to check their rates schedule. Weekdays before noon are cheapest for the first 2 floors. We arrived on a Thursday at 11:30am. They said it would be a 30 minute wait for the first 2 floors, or we could go up to the top floor. It would've been the same price anyway so up we went. The top floor is nicer anyway because there are no kids, and the view is better. We got stationed at one of the bays on the very end, so it was a weird angle to play at.  The actual golfing was fun though! They have all kinds of clubs for you to use. There are different types of games also, but we just stuck with the basic one. Our first hour went by super fast because no one had golfed before so we took forever. We added an extra hour, which I thought was a bit overkill. I started getting really tired of golf by 90 min, but did enjoy watching others hit and cheering them on.  They have an extensive menu if you want to order drinks or food. There is also a pool and cornhole in the non golfing areas.  The price isn't too bad if you're mindful. Extra hours, food, and drinks could make your final bill very large. But if you're in Vegas, you're probably willing to splurge for a good time!

nr7smcjXo26VZpzM7BJ__Q.text: Great place to visit , it was my first time going to a driving range and had a blast. I took my 17 year old and he really enjoyed it, he really liked the set up with the comfortable sitting area and the view of sports playing while you play. The food was good and so were the drinks, the servers were very attentive and friendly.  We will be going back when we get a chance since there isn't one in California.

iRtLeLk17dcGP2mc9xwPvw.text: Its fun but man is it pricey.  Always better in larger groups but every time I go...the scoring seems to be off.  Of the multiple times I go...we cant seem to get on the same swing count.  I will continue to come back whenever I am in Vegas.  The thing that really put me off was on my last visit I had a $10 off voucher as well as I have the M Life Military card.  As I wasn't sure what the Top Golf discount was I asked our server what would be the better discount off our $300 bill.  She didn't blink and said the $10 voucher was the better discount.  Found out later the discount for military is 10%.  You do the math but our server was wrong or just didn't care enough to check.  So they advertise the M Life for Veterans but did nothing to back it up.  Even after I filled out the survey after.  Not a peep back from Top Golf.

VAziEqqecLlSiGs8_C8ntg.text: I was here for the food and the salmon bowl was my favorite. Very happy and hip staff. It's a fun place to check out if you're in Vegas.  Fun for the whole family !

jmg37L3VPCNA2kcigN7k-A.text: Our whole family of 8 with kids came here for a great night of food, drinks and family fun.  We got a second floor golf driving range bay that felt like a high tech, and first class bowling alley lounge seating.  It had monitors to watch the ball as the ball is tracked n scored for points to hit targets.  Tv screens are everywhere.  Music plays throughout the venue.  Clubs are included included left handed clubs upon requests.    The back drop of the range is the Vegas strip with tons of neon lights.  The tees and targets are lite nicely in neon lights.  The range n grass look so good that it looks fake with the lighting and Vegas background. Go during sunset or night.  It's worth it.   If you can't golf, don't worry about it, it's a great time for all.  Kids have a blast!  Try to hit the ball, laugh with friends, drink a cocktail, n eat good food.  Great times!

EXjGuU6rlpquYv3YTU680Q.text: This was overall a pretty fun and cool place, but my rating is based on service. First of all, we had 6 people, but no one told us that only 5 people could play at a time. Also, we had to wait about 45 minutes to get a spot at our bay on 3rd floor, but it seemed that there were a lot of bays open when we got there. Not sure if it was crowded before and everyone just left all at once, but maybe they reserve some for others?  Once we got to the bay, it took about 30 minutes for someone to take our order for drinks. We stayed about 2 hours and our waitress only checked in on us twice. She even forgot one of our drinks. Lastly, our bill came out to $280 and we gave our waitress $300, and she saint even give us change back. She rudely just assumed that the rest was her tip without even asking us. Our experience would've been so much better if service was better.
